p: Previous studies have indicated the potential anti-inflammatory effects of S. nervosum extracts and DMC, which verified the traditional uses of the plant in folklore medicine, for example, skin diseases, pimples, and breast inflammation. S. nervosum extracts and its major flavonoid (DMC) were found to downregulate the expression of inflammatory and proinflammatory mediators. However, there have been limited animal studies on anti-inflammatory activities of the plant and isolated bioactive compounds.
